H0.text: name the four major layers of the earth in order. Crust, Mantle, Outer Core, Atmosphere

H1.text: name the four major layers of the earth in order. Crust, Lithosphere, Asthenosphere, Mesosphere

H2.text: name the four major layers of the earth in order. Crust, Mantle, Outer Core, Oceans

H3.text: name the four major layers of the earth in order. a solid inner core

A4.text: Earth's inner core is the innermost geologic layer of the planet Earth.

A5.text: The thin parts are the oceanic crust, which underlies the ocean basins (5â€“10 km).

A6.text: The pedosphere interfaces with the lithosphere, the hydrosphere, the atmosphere, and the biosphere.

A7.text: The lithosphere is broken into tectonic plates whose motion allows heat to escape the interior of Earth into space.

A8.text: The crust lies on top of the mantle, a configuration that is stable because the upper mantle is made of peridotite and is therefore significantly denser than the crust.
